definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Does this bus go to Silk Street?
sentences.chinese: 這輛公交車經過秀水街嗎？

sentences.english: The bus was so packed and I got totally squished this morning.
sentences.chinese: 公交車擠滿了人，我今天早上幾乎被壓扁了。
肯當時還引進了身長18米的鉸接式公交車。

sentences.english: Some buses in Beijing have a box near a box near the driver.
sentences.chinese: 北京的公交車在司機的附近有個盒子。

sentences.english: Before I got to the bus stop, the bus had already left.
sentences.chinese: 到了公交車站前，汽車已經開走了。

sentences.english: On the bus we should offer our seats to the old, and young.
sentences.chinese: 公交車上，我們要主動給老幼讓座。

sentences.english: Turns out I paid the bus driver $200.
sentences.chinese: 臥槽我投了200刀給公交車麼。

sentences.english: He can take the No. 57 bus.
Laurance- Is this where I catch the bus for the zoo?
sentences.chinese: 我能在這坐公交車去動物園嗎？

sentences.english: Does he know where I can take a bus to the suburbs.
sentences.chinese: 他知道在哪裏我可以坐公交車到郊外去嗎？

sentences.english: The teacher ran from the bus to get help.
sentences.chinese: 那個老師跑下公交車去求助。

sentences.english: You can go to May 4 Square by No. 26 bus.
sentences.chinese: 你可以坐26路公交車去五四廣場。

sentences.english: No, I always take a bus.
sentences.chinese: 不，我總是坐公交車上班。

sentences.english: Complicated bus routes crisscrossingDespite of your choice.
sentences.chinese: 公交車的路線繁雜交錯，任君選擇。

sentences.english: Today, I was getting on a bus, the driver shut the door on me while I was half way inside.
sentences.chinese: 今天我坐公交車時，剛上到一半司機就關門了。

sentences.english: I like to plug in an audiobook while I´m on the bus or walking somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡在公交車或步行去某地的時候聽有聲讀物。

definition: bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
to take the car, bus, train etc
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to take a taxi (in town)/to hitch a lift
